lexUnit.name: tear.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pull or rip apart or to pieces.

sentence.text: However , with Black against Karpov it is almost impossible to avoid this kind of situation and the desire to tear Karpov apart with bare hands as it were , is quite unrealistic .
I can hear Anya 's voice -- a low secret murmur -- in the kitchen , along with the hiss of steam , the tintinnabulation of a teaspoon , the scream of a biscuit packet being torn apart .
It was when ` the Spirit of the Lord came mightily upon him " that ` he tore a lion asunder as one tears a kid " ( Judg. 14:6 ) .
In the Wallowa valley , Old Joseph tore in two the piece of paper he called the Thief Treaty .
Eventually , I was strong enough to concentrate on tearing the hare into pieces , impaling the joints on sticks , and thrusting them into the glowing heat of my fire .
He took the list and began tearing it into small pieces .
ROBERT HOPKINS , a young Queensland aborigine , tried to hang himself in a prison cell using a blanket torn into strips .
He tore one of Mum 's dusters into strips for this purpose and we busied ourselves counting out sticks and piling up bundles .
She picked up the dress and tore the thin material into several strips , then began to make a tourniquet .
` I used to tear telephone books in half as a sort of party trick . "
She took the two halves of the letter away , tore them in fragments , and burned them in her grate .
She then tried to tear the plans in half , but the paper was of a strong variety .
I could tear you in two , but I 'm not really here .
Tear the paper into bits , and flush it down the toilet .
Alida Thorne read the letter again , and then tore it into forty or fifty tiny squares , her hand shaking with anger .
` They 're tearing him into four , " said Snodgrass .
Beside the Cross one of the men had torn a paper into little bits and scattered them , to a groaning catcall from the crowd .
In his autobiographical novel , The Favourite Game , he tells how Breavman ` tried to fight his anger with a softer emotion , " and how ` he tore the books as his father weakened . "
BILLY Connolly 's got his out-of-work wife Pam a job in the circus -- as long as he agrees to tear the tickets .
Actaeon sees and Actaeon is torn , wrote Harsnet , but Ovid in his exile by the Black Sea neither sees the Goddess nor is torn by the dogs .
So why do n't you just settle to knowing your place and doing your job , and just maybe I wo n't let him tear you in shreds the way he 's aching to do ?
` That 's just what I said to myself when I woke up this morning , but when I looked on the floor , there was the veil , torn in two halves ! "
She had given him some newspaper torn into squares and a glass of dark-brown liquid that tasted like spanish water .
